summary: SummaryHighlightsHSA/FSA eligibleCeraVe AM Facial Moisturizing Lotion SPF 30 for Balanced to Oily Skin is an oil-free daily face sunscreen & moisturizer that offers UV protection and helps restore the skin's barrier.
details: DetailsBenefitsDaily-use face moisturizer with SPF 30Ultra-fine zinc oxide provides broad-spectrum SPF 30 UVA/UVB protectionAbsorbs quickly and leaves a non-greasy finishHelps restore the skin's protective barrier with 3 essential ceramidesHydrates the skin with hyaluronic acidProvides soothing benefits with niacinamideTravel Size / Under TSA liquid limitSuitable for dry skin, sensitive skin, oily skin and acne-prone skinNon-comedogenic and won't clog pores or cause acne flare-upsAccepted by the National Eczema AssociationRecommended for daily use by the Skin Cancer FoundationDeveloped with dermatologistsKey IngredientsCeramides: Essential for healthy skin, Ceramides are found naturally in the skin and help restore skin's natural barrier, helping to lock in moisture and keep harmful elements out.InVisibleZinc Technology features micro-fine zinc oxide for SPF 30 broad-spectrum sunscreen protectionHyaluronic acid: This ingredient attracts hydration to the skinâ€™s surface and helps the skin retain moistureNiacinamide: Helps calm skinMVE Technology: A patented delivery system, continually releases moisturizing ingredientsFormulated WithoutOilFragranceItem 2241990How To UseApply liberally 15 minutes before sun exposure.Reapply at least every 2 hours.Use a water-resistant sunscreen if swimming or sweating.Children under 6 months: Ask a doctor.++Build your Everyday Routine with CeraVe:++++Cleanse++ :Hydrating Cream to Foam Cleanser: Cleanses, hydrates and helps restore the protective skin barrier++Treat++ :H ydrating **Hyaluronic Acid Serum:**Replenishes skin hydration while helping restore the protective skin barrier++Moisturize:++ Moisturizing **Cream:**Moisturizes and helps restore the protective skin barrier++Protect:++ Hydrating **Face Mineral Sunscreen SPF 50:**100% mineral sunscreen to reflect the sun's harmful rays plus three essential ceramides to help restore skin's natural barrierPrecautions: For external use only. When using this product avoid contact with the eyes. If contact occurs, rinse eyes thoroughly with water. Stop use and ask a doctor if signs of irritation or rash appear and persist. Keep out of reach of children. If swallowed, get medical help or contact a Poison Control Center right away. UV exposure from the sun increases the risk of skin cancer, premature skin aging, and other damage. It is important to decrease UV exposure by limiting time in the sun, wearing protective clothing, and using sunscreen.IngredientsActive: Homosalate 12%, Octinoxate 7.5%, Octocrylene 2%, Zinc Oxide 3.5%. Inactive: Purified Water, Niacinamide, Behentrimonium Methosulfate and Cetearyl Alcohol, Glycerin, Aluminum Starch Octenylsuccinate and Boron Nitride, Dimethicone, Ceramide 3, Ceramide 6-II, Ceramide 1, Cholesterol, Hyaluronic Acid, Phytosphingosine, Hydroxyethylcellulose, Disodium EDTA, Sodium Lauroyl Lactylate, Methylparaben, Propylparaben, Carbomer, Xanthan Gum.
how_to_use: Apply liberally 15 minutes before sun exposure.Reapply at least every 2 hours.Use a water-resistant sunscreen if swimming or sweating.Children under 6 months: Ask a doctor.++Build your Everyday Routine with CeraVe:++++Cleanse++ :Hydrating Cream to Foam Cleanser: Cleanses, hydrates and helps restore the protective skin barrier++Treat++ :H ydrating **Hyaluronic Acid Serum:**Replenishes skin hydration while helping restore the protective skin barrier++Moisturize:++ Moisturizing **Cream:**Moisturizes and helps restore the protective skin barrier++Protect:++ Hydrating **Face Mineral Sunscreen SPF 50:**100% mineral sunscreen to reflect the sun's harmful rays plus three essential ceramides to help restore skin's natural barrierPrecautions: For external use only. When using this product avoid contact with the eyes. If contact occurs, rinse eyes thoroughly with water. Stop use and ask a doctor if signs of irritation or rash appear and persist. Keep out of reach of children. If swallowed, get medical help or contact a Poison Control Center right away. UV exposure from the sun increases the risk of skin cancer, premature skin aging, and other damage. It is important to decrease UV exposure by limiting time in the sun, wearing protective clothing, and using sunscreen.
ingredients: Aluminum Starch Octenylsuccinate and Boron Nitride

reviews.headline: Peelingâ€¦.
reviews.comments: Not greasy for oily or combination skin, but it peels so much! Not a fan of it.

reviews.headline: It's ok. Very basic and it does the job
reviews.comments: I only use cerave products and this lotion is ok. It does work but i feel like there are better products. If you're on a budget and want an affordable spf for the afternoon then this is a decent product.

reviews.headline: Mediocre at best
reviews.comments: Great that it has zinc ozide but is NOT moisturizing and doesn't absorb into the skin very well (often leaves white residue).

reviews.headline: So disappointing
reviews.comments:
Definitely returning the lotion!
It feels greasier than I would like, it does not absorb well into the skin, and when you try to work it in better it just starts peeling, it looks awful! I wiped it off my face as soon as I could

reviews.headline: Not as good as a thought
reviews.comments: I bought it because my skin always reacts good to Cerave products, but this was just bad. Leaves a white cast and if i try to blend it in, it starts pilling. Even after washing my face good and exfoliating, and NOT having anything under this product.

reviews.headline: Cerave- please create a version of this without the casting
reviews.comments: I love cerave products but this one i just can't do. The white casting is awful. Its 2025, there's a way to make it effective without the white stuff. I don't recommend

reviews.headline: Pills badly
reviews.comments: 16 for this is wild

reviews.headline: Would be better
reviews.comments: leaves a white cast on skin. takes awhile to rub in and it pills with the rubbing.

reviews.headline: Thick and white residue
reviews.comments: Product left a white residue on my skin, even when a tiny bit applied.  It took several minutes, including wiping any excess off, to get the lotion to absorb and remove white residue.  thick consistency. Looks bad on darker complexion, or black skin.

reviews.headline: Holy grail product
reviews.comments: I've been using CeraVe's AM and PM moisturizers since my mid-20s and they have never failed me. I'm currently 33 and get told all the time I look a decade younger. The AM moisturizer is lightweight, keeps my face hydrated and not greasy feeling, and absorbs well; I use 2, rarely 3, pumps and have plenty of product. A little goes a long way. As far as the pilling other reviews have mentioned, make sure you're giving it enough time to absorb into your skin before using other products and exfoliating/dermaplaning also helps with the application. I've had maybe ONE bad bottle that did this since I started using this brand, and doing the above remedied the problem. Can't recommend CeraVe enough!

reviews.headline: Wanted to love it but it pills sometimes
reviews.comments: I end up having to wash my face and reapply a different sunscreen when it happens ðŸ˜© couldn't even finish the bottle before getting sick of it

reviews.headline: No
reviews.comments: Made my face feel sticky.

reviews.headline: Not my favorite
reviews.comments: Dermatologist recommended yes, the only sunscreen that doesn't work is the one you dont apply yes, but shoukd it it pill like this? Id prefer it didnt.

reviews.headline: Not good
reviews.comments: Pills and leave a white cast on your face. Would definitely not repurchase. Im actually surprised it has any good reviews.

reviews.headline: #iagree erase
reviews.comments: Love has it feels on the face.  Keeps moisture all day anf face doesnt burn

reviews.headline: High hopes
reviews.comments: This was recommended to me, so I was really excited to try the product, but it peeled on my face and put such a white cast on me then I'm planning to return it

reviews.headline: Not moisturizing
reviews.comments: I do not like this product because it does not rub in easily or moisturize as well as I would like. Just not for my skin, others might like this product.

reviews.headline: So. Much. Pilling.
reviews.comments: Wish I'd read more reviews before buying. I was looking for a good spf moisturizer for oily skin. This is okay I guess if you wear nothing else on your face. But the second I try to put on any primer, forget it.

reviews.headline: not a fan
reviews.comments: This does not rub in well and the pump quit working before I was even halfway through the bottle

reviews.headline: HORRIBLE AND PILLS HORRIBLY
reviews.comments: Its horrible, it pills so bad, horrible white cast, legit the worst sunscreen ive ever used

faceoff_positive.comments: I'm glad I bought this before I read some of the negative reviews.  Everyone has such different skin and I may have stayed away from this product once I read those, I'm glad I didn't! For reference: I am 44, acne prone, with dark skin and have eczema -- I'm allergic to a lot of products.  I am also using a product for my acne called Tazorac so sunscreen is a necessity.  I found this product to rub in well, it feels good, does not irritate, and I didn't feel like I had that white film you often get with sunscreens.  I wear under make up and my make up goes on smoothly after.  I do wait about 10 min post shower to put the lotion on, and wait until after I do my hair to apply my make up which I think helps with having it absorb and layering under make up.  (If I put on the lotion while my skin is damp, it doesn't absorb well, and if I apply my make up immediately after, I do feel like it's a bit too much).  I really like using this as it doesn't irritate with my eczema, moisturizes, does not cause break outs, contains the sunscreen I need and looks good under make up.
faceoff_positive.headline: I use this every day

faceoff_negative.comments: If I could give this zero stars I would!  I bought this AM Facial Moisturizing Lotion because I ran out of my normal facial lotion during a business trip and had heard good things about CeraVe.   I was so mistaken.  Upon first application on my face the following day, it stung a little around my eyes but I just thought it was from lack of sleep due to traveling.  I used it again the following day and the same stinging happened but was a bit worse and was just around my eyes so I thought maybe I developed an issue with my L'Oreal eye moisturizer I have been using for a year.  So I tried the CeraVe again the third day, this time my whole face stung and I knew it was that moisturizer.  The following day I did not use the CeraVe but my eye area still stung very bad, started getting itchy and was tender.  That evening, my right eyebrow and eyelid area swelled up and the skin around both eyes felt raw.  The 2nd day after last use, my right eye was swollen even more and the skin around my eyes and mouth felt raw, itchy and stung badly.  My eyes also watered a lot and made the skin sting and irritated even more.  The 3rd day after not using CeraVe, I woke up with both eyes swollen shut an my eye area and around my mouth felt rough and scabby, itchy and was very red.  The fourth day my eyes are still itchy, puffy and swollen, very red and the scabby skin is still scabby and starting to flake a little like I got a chemical burn.  I have taken a antihistamine each day since I stopped used the lotion and it has helped some but I am still experiencing the swelling, itchiness and red scabby raw skin. I cannot go to work looking like I went 10 rounds with Mike Tyson!   If you use this product, do a test on a small patch of your skin for a couple days first!!   I would like my money back on this product but I bought it while traveling and I am now home.
faceoff_negative.headline: Horrible reaction to this moisturizer!!
